changelog.release_notes: v0.12: Color renders 1bit, 2bit and 4bit color textures for the walls and floor/ceiling.  Outside sky blue now instead of black.  Won't get stuck in walls when generating maze.

3D FPS Arena3D v0.10 beta:
Supports color, but only 1 bit color (for now)
First release to the Pebble AppStore (2015-06-15)
Was released on mypebblefaces.com a year ago, but saw limited attention.
Releasing here on Pebble AppStore to gauge any positive reaction and if I should keep working on this or abandon it for other projects.

data.description:
A simple Doom or Wolfenstein like 3D raycaster.  There is no goal or objective, just walking around and seeing the Pebble's ability to render a 3D game.

Use the accelerometer to move.
To remain stationary, watch should be flat with screen pointing up
Tilt up/down to move forward/backward
Tilt left/right to rotate
Hold the bottom button and tilt left/right to strafe.
Press the middle button to shoot out walls. (Try going outside!)
Press the top button to generate a random maze.

The smiley face guy is just there as a sprite rendering test.  He doesn't do anything besides sit there and be happy.  He knows you cannot harm him.  Currently, sprites only show up in the black and white version.

I made this over a year ago (posted it to mypebblefaces.com) and planned on fleshing it out into a full fledged game, but I mostly only got negative feedback (nobody wants a 3D game on their watch).  If anybody would like this progressed any further, let me know.  Either way, I may continue to update it from time to time just for fun. I have shared the full source code if anyone wants to learn how this was created.

Source: https://github.com/robisodd/
